intro: Gymnandra gracilis, commonly known as the slender gymnandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a central cluster of stamens. Gymnandra gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
